Translations.Text: Recount your Lord's mercy on His servant Zechariah
When he called to His Lord silently
he said, "My Lord, my bones have weakened, and my head shimmers with grey hair, but never, Lord, have I failed to be blessed in praying to you
And I fear what my kinsfolk [will do] after I am gone. My wife has been barren, so give me an heir as a gift from You
one who will receive my inheritance and he will be an heir to the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing to You
O Zechariah, We bring you good news of a son whose name will be John, a name We have never given to anyone else before
[Zechariah] said, "My Lord, how will I have a son when my wife has been barren and I have reached advanced old age
He said, "It will be so. Your Lord says: 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, when you were nothing
[Zechariah] said, "My Lord, give me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to people for three full nights
So he came out from the sanctuary and signaled his people to glorify [God] in the morning and in the evening
